feat.name: Arcane Sensitivity
entries: You can sense the presence of the supernatural, even if you don't have any magical ability yourself. You can spend a single action (this action has the {@trait concentrate} trait) to determine if any magical auras are present in the area.

This has the effects of a 1st-level {@spell detect magic} spell but isn't magical. By straining, you can also discover the source of the magic and its school (with the effect of a 4th-level {@spell detect magic} spell), but doing so prevents you from using this ability again until you've rested for 8 hours.

feat.name: Bolera's Interrogation
entries: You focus your attention on a single creature within 30 feet. That creature must attempt a Will save against your {@skill Perception} DC. On a failure, the creature finds itself unable to speak any deliberate and intentional lies and takes a –2 penalty to {@skill Deception} checks. On a critical failure, the penalty to {@skill Deception} checks is –4. This effect lasts for 10 minutes as long as you are within 30 feet of the target and the target is aware that you are using the ability against it.
If you begin a new interrogation, this effect ends for any previous target. After your interrogation ends, the target is immune to this ability for 24 hours.

feat.name: Edgewatch Detective Dedication
entries: You become trained in {@skill Society} or {@skill Thievery}; if you are already trained in both of these skills, you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You can use {@skill Perception} instead of {@skill Survival} to {@action Track}, and you gain the {@feat Experienced Tracker} skill feat (Core Rulebook 261).
special: You can't select another dedication feat until you have gained two other feats from the this archetype.

feat.name: Sense Alignment
entries: You read the body language of an intelligent creature within 30 feet and pick up on subtle cues to detect its general propensity for good or evil and law or chaos. The GM rolls a secret {@skill Perception} check, comparing the result against the target's {@skill Deception} DC.

entries.Success: You ascertain the target's alignment, but only along one axis (your choice of either the good-evil axis or the lawful-chaotic axis).
entries.Failure: You do not learn the target's alignment.
entries.Critical Failure: You incorrectly ascertain the target's alignment, misidentifying their alignment along either one axis or both (GM's choice).
